content: is there such a thing as  Books: designing (click-fit) 3d-printed models; 3d-printing for mould-making?

Yes, there are books available on designing click-fit 3D-printed models as well as 3D-printing for mold-making. These books provide detailed instructions, techniques, and tips for designing and 3D-printing click-fit models and molds. They cover various aspects such as software tools, design principles, printing techniques, and post-processing methods. Some popular books in this area include:

1. "Mastering 3D Printing" by Joan Horvath and Rich Cameron.
2. "Design for 3D Printing: Scanning, Creating, Editing, Remixing, and Making in Three Dimensions" by Samuel N. Bernier, Bertier Luyt, and Tatiana Reinhard.
3. "3D Printing and CNC Fabrication with SketchUp" by Lydia Sloan Cline.
4. "Mold Making for 3D Printing: An In-Depth Guide to Making Exclusive, Replicable 3D Printed Objects" by Tatiana Reinhard.
5. "Practical 3D Printers: The Science and Art of 3D Printing" by Brian Evans.

These books provide a comprehensive understanding of the concepts and techniques involved in designing 3D-printed models and molds, and they can serve as valuable resources for beginners as well as experienced designers.
